pullRequest.title: Created 'internal.provider' package for our provider implementations
pullRequest.bodyText: Created the 'internal.provider' package which holds the implementation of our provider interfaces. Also cleaned up the JavaDoc in AndroidClientLogger to no longer use '@inheritdoc', as it is not necessary.

commit.message: Corrected reference in JacksonAdapter for class that was renamed.
Merge branch 'dev' of github.com:Azure/azure-sdk-for-android into dev
Merge branch 'dev' of github.com:Azure/azure-sdk-for-android into dev
Changed UserAgentInterceptor to use the correct header name ("User-Agent") in requests.
Merge branch 'dev' of github.com:Azure/azure-sdk-for-android into dev

Created internal.provider package which holds the implementation of our provider interfaces. Also cleaned up the JavaDoc in AndroidClientLogger.

beforeCommit.message: Moved BiFunction to the threeten package.

afterCommit.message: Created internal.provider package which holds the implementation of our provider interfaces. Also cleaned up the JavaDoc in AndroidClientLogger.

nodes.bodyText: By making this change, do we actually need the AndroidApplicationInformationProvider to be public any more? Meaning it would be package-private, but people can still get an instance of it by calling this public method.
And if the answer is that it can be package-private, should we then move it out of the internal namespace and directly into com.azure.android.core.provider?

commit.message: Moved the provider implementations out of the 'internal.provider' package and into the 'provider' package. Changed AndroidLocaleInformationProvider so its constructor uses a Context reference instead of one of Configuration.
Created a convenience constructor that takes a Context to extract data from. Modified the argument order of some constructors to follow the Java SDK (passing application ID first).
Move provider implementations to internal package
Further cleaned up UserAgentInterceptor public interface
